section-1.text: "Only 3 more minutes to recess," Lee anxiously thought.
Ms. Rodriguez continued explaining their homework.
Lee had written it all down; she always wrote everything down.
She understood claim, evidence, and conclusion.
But addressing a counterclaim felt slippery and hard to hold.
The bell rang and Lee raced out with her journal to meet Tee, nervous and excited.

section-2.text: Recess had barely started and the yard was already loud.
Kickball shouts clashed with double-dutch ropes and tag arguments.
Near the benches, kids crowded into a circle.
"That is definitely a battle," Tee said, walking toward it.
Lee followed, notebook hugged tight; the noise wrapped her like static.
Tee walked like the sound belonged to him, so she stayed close.

section-3.text: Jayden stood in the middle, chin high, eyes locked on Tee.
"There you go. Big talk Tee. Try not to choke," he shouted.
A few kids laughed as the circle tightened.
Tee folded his arms. "You sure you want this?"
Jayden stepped forward and went first with his verse.
The crowd erupted when he finished; hands flew to mouths and feet stomped.

section-4.text: Tee didn't yell; she stayed calm and pulled out receipts.
"Okay, Jayden. Let's talk about it," she said.
Lee watched as Tee broke it down step by step.
She restated his claim to show she heard him.
She shared attendance records as evidence.
She explained why his claim was wrong and restated her position.

section-4-summary.text: His eyes darted around the circle looking for someone to rescue him with evidence.
